paragraphs.text: %md # DataSci Tutorial 1: R Setup for Zeppelin and RStudio Server This tutorial was built for BDCS-CE version 17.4.1 as part of the Data Science Acceleration User Journey: here. Questions and feedback about the tutorial: These DataSci tutorials build on top of the New Data Lake tutorial. Please start with the New Data Lake User Journey. In particular, be sure you previously ran the New Data Lake Tutorials: "Citi Bike New York Demo Introduction and Setup" and "Working with Hive". This notebook provides shell scripts to configure R for Zeppelin and to install RStudio Server, which is an optional third-party tool to help with R coding.

msg.data:
DataSci Tutorial 1: R Setup for Zeppelin and RStudio Server

This tutorial was built for BDCS-CE version 17.4.1 as part of the Data Science Acceleration User Journey: here. Questions and feedback about the tutorial: david.bayard@oracle.com

These DataSci tutorials build on top of the New Data Lake tutorial.  Please start with the New Data Lake User Journey.  In particular, be sure you previously ran the 
New Data Lake Tutorials: "Citi Bike New York Demo Introduction and Setup" and "Working with Hive".

This notebook provides shell scripts to configure R for Zeppelin and to install RStudio Server, which is an optional third-party tool to help with R coding.

paragraphs.title: Script to setup R for use with Zeppelin (will take about 15 minutes)
paragraphs.text:
%sh

echo "Starting script to setup R for use with Zeppelin. Please be patient.  You will not see any more output until it is finished."

sudo /usr/bin/enable-zeppelin-r.sh > /tmp/install-oracle-r.log 2>&1

echo ".."
echo ".."
echo "First 50 lines..."
head -50 /tmp/install-oracle-r.log

echo ".."
echo ".."
echo "Last 50 lines..."
tail -50 /tmp/install-oracle-r.log

echo ".."
echo ".."
echo "done"

echo "done"

paragraphs.title: Install RStudio Server (will take about a minute)
Create a user for RStudio Server
paragraphs.text:
%sh
cat <<EOF > /tmp/r_user.sh
	useradd ruser
	echo -e "welcome1\nwelcome1" | passwd ruser
	echo "finsihed adduser" 
	usermod -a -G hive,hadoop ruser
	echo "finsihed groups" 
	sudo -u hdfs hadoop fs -mkdir /user/ruser
	sudo -u hdfs hadoop fs -chown ruser /user/ruser
	echo "finsihed hdoop fs commands" 
EOF

chmod a+x /tmp/r_user.sh
sudo /tmp/r_user.sh

echo "done"

%md
# Restart the Zeppelin notebook

Now that we've installed some additional R packages for Zeppelin, you may need to restart the Zeppelin Notebook for R to work.  To do so,

+ Go to the Setting tab
+ Click on Notebook
+ Click on Restart

msg.data:
Restart the Zeppelin notebook

Now that we’ve installed some additional R packages for Zeppelin, you may need to restart the Zeppelin Notebook for R to work. To do so,

  • Go to the Setting tab
  • Click on Notebook
  • Click on Restart

paragraphs.title: Test that R is working (will take a minute for initial startup)
List of R packages now installed
paragraphs.text:
%r
ip <- as.data.frame(installed.packages()[,c(1,3:4)])
rownames(ip) <- NULL
ip <- ip[is.na(ip$Priority),1:2,drop=FALSE]
print(ip, row.names=FALSE)

%md
# Next Steps

Your BDCS-CE environment is now setup with R, SparkR, RStudio Server, and many common R packages.

Proceed to the next Tutorial to see R and SparkR in action with the Zeppelin Notebook.

msg.data:
Next Steps

Your BDCS-CE environment is now setup with R, SparkR, RStudio Server, and many common R packages.

Proceed to the next Tutorial to see R and SparkR in action with the Zeppelin Notebook.

### Change Log
November 16, 2017 - Updated for 17.4.1.  R is now installed, but need to still add some packages like knitr to work with Zeppelin
September 12, 2017 - Confirmed it works with BDCSCE 17.3.5
August 13, 2017 - Confirmed it works with BDCS-CE 17.3.3-20
August 11, 2017 - First version
